title: Navy Radar Training Launched a Career in Computer Science
sub_head: Bruce W. Arden, who has died at age 94, made mainframes more accessible and used them to calculate missile trajectories
body:
Bruce W. Arden endured part of his childhood on a farm in Kansas with no indoor plumbing or electricity. At age 17, in 1944, he enlisted in the U.S. Navy and learned the elements of electronics as a radar technician.
“Luck ushered me into digital computing,” he wrote in a memoir offered to friends and family. After World War II, at the Allison division of General Motors , he helped design parts for jet engines and graduated from slide rules to an IBM card-programmed calculator. “My responsibility was to make it work,” he recalled.
